title: East Gallatin River
text:
The East Gallatin River flows in a northwesterly direction through the Gallatin valley, <a href="Gallatin%20County%2C%20Montana">Gallatin County, Montana</a>. Rising from the confluence of Rocky Creek and several other small streams, the East Gallatin begins about one mile (1.6 km) east of downtown <a href="Bozeman%2C%20Montana">Bozeman, Montana</a>. The river joins the main stem of the <a href="Gallatin%20River">Gallatin River</a> north of <a href="Manhattan%2C%20Montana">Manhattan, Montana</a>. Throughout its course, the river traverses mostly valley floor ranch and farm land with typical summer flows of approximately .
Angling the East Gallatin.
The East Gallatin river is a popular trout fishing stream and holds good populations of <a href="Rainbow%20trout">rainbow</a> and <a href="brown%20trout">brown trout</a> as well as <a href="mountain%20whitefish">mountain whitefish</a>. Access is limited to country road crossings and two public assess sites maintained by the Montana Fish, Wildlife and Parks department. Numerous <a href="spring%20creek">spring creek</a>s, most notably Ben Hart and Thompson, feed the East Gallatin throughout its course and provide excellent trout fishing as well.
